results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Coeur de pirate by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: We kick off 2014 with an interview and sneak peek at the forthcoming album by Coeur de Pirate. There's music inspired by the Arab Spring, new instrumentals from High Priest, My Panda Shall Fly, and Battle Ground Grammar, plus Toro Y Moi, Alden Penner, and up and coming acts like Aleem Khan and Mekka.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: The Grand Finale
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Black Milk by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Black Milk joins Andrew Jervis in our second 2013 extravaganza. Also picking tunes are Lars Gotrich from NPR  Music, and Glenn Jackson from electronic music guide, XLR8R. Laurent Fintoni of Original Cultures & FACT Magazine, and John Bailey & Ennio Styles of 3RRR radio drop mixes of their faves.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Taster's Choice
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Haley Bonar by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Celebrating a year of music Andrew picks favorite tunes and interviews Sam Valenti of Ghostly International, Joe Kay of Soulection, and Josh Dalton of the excellent Crack in the Road blog. Haley Bonar, our artist of the week, chats about her sublime Wntr Sands album, and the Paris DJs drop an exclusive 2013 mix.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Ain't No Stoppin' Us Now
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Jean Grae by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: MC, producer, comedian, and actor Jean Grae joins the show this week, and we air electronic tunes by Johnny Ripper, Fremdkunst, and Kiln. We've got gems from newer acts like Goofy Foot, Evan Geesman, Miss Kenichi, Rachel Brotman, and Reverse People, and we'll peek at the upcoming album from Czech duo Dva.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Movin' in the Right Direction
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Calico Galaxy by Paul Grelet.
results.desc:
Fatima and brothers Nick and Mike Rufolo (aka the Brothers Nylon & Calico Galaxy) drop by this week's show. We also air new music from Painted Palms, Jerome LOL, 
Canadian-Haitian singer Melissa Laveaux, along with some Polish afrobeat, and an amazing jazz version of Junior Murvin's "Police and Thieves."

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Winter Warmers
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Diggs Duke by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Our artist of the week is Diggs Duke, and album of the week is by Marley Carroll. Listen up for new tunes by Rosie Lowe, Koda and Bijou, Mother Falcon, and The Delegators. We sneak a peek at the Slakah the Beatchild album, and play indie gems from Juniore out of Paris, and Gap Dream from California.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Hear In You
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Milosh by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Our artist of the week is Milosh, and album of the week is the new Cosmic Compositions Sun Ra-influenced comp. We air tunes from around the world including the freaky soul of LA-based Seven Davis Jr., plus CV313's Detroit dub, psyche garage from San Francisco, and robotic beats from London.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: The Old Magic is Back
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of ERAAS by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Brooklyn-based Eraas and amazing UK singer ESKA join Andrew Jervis to talk about their new releases. We also air tunes from GEMS out of Washington DC, Frenchman Sebastien Tellier, and the New Zealand-based Shocking Pinks, plus Jacob Collier, and 2 tracks from the Raw Tapes label out of Tel Aviv.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: So Heavy
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Toxic Holocaust by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Bob of Relapse Records and Rob of Liquid Metal join Andrew Jervis on a special episode digging deep into the 90,000+ metal titles on Bandcamp. Toxic Holocaust guests, and Pitchfork writer Kim Kelly and Vince Neilstein of Metal Sucks provide insight and tunes.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: We Got Game
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Danny Baranowsky by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: A special edition of the BC Weekly focused entirely on video game music. Game soundtracks have sold nearly a quarter million units on the site, pulling in just shy of $1.5 million dollars. Austin Wintory, Jim Guthrie, Disasterpeace, Danny Baranowsky, Big Giant Circles, and Laura Shigihara provide insight and tunes.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: 5th Anniversary Special
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of THEESatisfaction by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Celebrating five years of Bandcamp (and a shiny new app), we feature guest mixes from Seattle MC/production duo THEESatisfaction and eclectic Brazilian selector Rodrigo Brandao (Mais Um Discos). We also chat with Shigeto, and air tracks by Diggs Duke, Lord Echo, Jean Grae, Sufjan Stevens and Zoë Keating.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Alternate Worlds
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Son Lux by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Featuring interviews and in-depth sneak peaks at new work from two adventurous musicians: singer and composer Son Lux, and also jazz-meets-techno producer Ian o'Brien. Plus fresh tunes from Om Unit, Lady, Jungle, Oval, Kelpe, Candy Says, Motion Picture Actress, and the Electric Peanut Butter Co.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Places We Go
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Da Lata by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: In a 26-track packed show we sneak a peak at Da Lata's welcome Afro-Brazilian return, and play new tunes by Knxwledge, Ta-Ku, Zo, Black Milk, and Perera Elsewhere. Album of the week is by Son of Stan. We air an oldie from Robert Wyatt, indie rock from Palehound, and abstract soul by Jitwam and Hot Sugar.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Pieces of a Dream
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Ohmega Watts by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Featuring new releases from THEESatisfaction, Oddisee, The Procussions, and Mishal Moore, plus MC, producer, graphic designer Ohmega Watts debuts tracks in an exclusive mix, and iamnobodi drops by to talk about our album of the week. New acts to look for include Equal, Bloom, Nekochan, and Panama.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Shapeshifters
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Fulgeance by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Elephant, Black Milk (with Dwele and Robert Glasper), Djinji Brown, Teen Daze, and Cuushe add bright electronics, jazz, and soul before Fulgeance (aka Souleance) drops Words of Wisdom. Dom La Nena, Milosh, and Peder bring an acoustic vibe to round out the second half of the show.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Floating Moments
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Archie Pelago by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: The 25th show features music by Quantic and Shigeto, plus tunes from the supremely anonymous Jungle. Emanative teams up with Earl Zinger, our album of the week is by Berlin-based Kyson, NY trio Archie Pelago speak Words of Wisdom, plus there's dub, classic Chicago house, and even a funky brass band.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Secret Angles
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Bosq Of Whiskey Barons by Niklas Åkerblad.
results.desc: Premiering tracks from Georgia Anne Muldrow's Jyoti album, plus brand new music by Tiny Hearts, and London based Midnight Davis. Dynasty teams up with Talib Kweli, and Klaus Layer with Blu and Scienze. Bosq colors the Words of Wisdom tropical, and Irresistible Force drops a signature remix.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Vibes From The Tribe
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Piers Faccini by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Album of the week from Lonnie Holley casts a cosmic spell over the rest of the track list including hip hop by Stainless Steele, electronics by Bad Bandit and Mountain Range, jazz by Dawn of Midi, and psyche rock from Sugar Candy Mountain. Lucho Neves plays mambo, Piers Faccini talks Words of Wisdom.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: And the kitchen sink...
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Hello Skinny by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Jam-packed show with debuts from Kishi Bashi and Kyson, words of wisdom from Hello Skinny, a new Richard Dorfmeister remix, tropical sounds by Bosq and Siji, electronic soul from Motion Picture Actress, beats out of Germany and Russia, and fuzzy indie rock from Paris, Auckland, and Oklahoma City.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Rough Around The Edges
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Ladi6 by Brett Affrunti.
results.desc: This week's selection includes twisted beats from California, London, and France, guilty pleasure pop from Alicia Eris, album of the week by Devon Who, the indie-stylings of Holy Ghost Party and These Animals, previously unreleased Robert Wyatt, jazz by Archie Pelago, and Ladi6 with the Words of Wisdom.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Pyramids and Stars
results.image_caption: Hosted by Ethan Diamond. Illustration of Emily Karpel by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Bandcamp’s Ethan Diamond fills in for Andrew Jervis this week and brings some of his personal favorites from the site, including deep French and Norwegian hip hop, long-lost Canadian funk, thumping Israeli electronica, and just enough face-melting hardcore and punk to get your head right.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly
results.subtitle: Who's Been Sitting In My Chair?
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Free The Robots by Niklas Åkerblad.
results.desc: Filling in for Andrew Jervis with their own local flavors are John Bailey and Ennio Styles of 3RRR FM in Melbourne, plus Dawson Ludwig from San Francisco's Noise Pop, and Londoner Laurent Fintoni of FACT Magazine and Original Cultures. Free The Robots drops by with the Words of Wisdom.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 18
results.subtitle: I Want To Take You Higher
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Sango by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Our Album of the Week is by the Superhumanoids, and we have first listens of Chicano Batman and Da Lata. Watch out for new acts W∆NR, Acapoco, and Basecamp, and hip hop from Phony Ppl and ProbCause with Diggs Duke. Sango speaks Words of Wisdom, and Felipe Arcazas gets psychedelic.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 17
results.subtitle: A Part of Something Missing
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Barbarossa by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: On this week’s show Barbarossa guests in the Words of Wisdom segment, and our album of the week is by Denitia and Sene. We air soulful new singles by Harleighblu, Lea Lea, and Part Panda, folksy punk from Twin Steps, electronic pop by Talk In Color, and afrobeat by The Cactus Channel.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 16
results.subtitle: Kids of the Sun
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Natasha Kmeto by Brett Affrunti.
results.desc: BC Weekly 16 has hip hop out of Mali, Japanese cosmic beats, edgy sounds from Brazil, plus debuts of Fortune Howl and the Fhloston Paradigm remix of our Words of Wisdom guest, Natasha Kmeto. We also air new songs from GEMS, Green Eyes, Native Bells, Sean J. Rankine, Jaytram, and Shoos Off.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 15
results.subtitle: Tunes A La Mode
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Chris Schlarb by Niklas Åkerblad.
results.desc: Debuting Sango's collaboration with JMSN, a surprise album from LAKE, and new tracks from artists to watch like Jan Roth, Grapell, and Stokeley. MALA and Soraia Drummond drop tropical bass lines. Chris Schlarb is our artist of the week, making ethereal jazz, spacey folk, and driving a 16 foot truck.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 14
results.subtitle: Play It Right
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Sylvan Esso by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: Brand new soulful folk tunes from Clem Snide and Hozier, hip hop from the Herbaliser-related Soundsci, plus chill wave from Sydney based I'lls and Young Pharoahs of Austin. Sylvan Esso drop by with words of wisdom, we air the debut Ethio-Cali Ensemble tune, and play an exclusive from Chieftain.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 13
results.subtitle: Pieces of Summer
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Francis Bebey by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Featuring the music of Francis Bebey and future Peruvian sound of Novalima, plus Tensei & the Ones, Jagan Mai, and Silver Firs.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 12
results.subtitle: Back To The Future
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Yosi Horikawa by Niklas Åkerblad.
results.desc: Debut singles from Sylvan Esso and Ang Low marry great pop songs with edgy production. Truly imaginative Yosi Horikawa guests in the Words of Wisdom segment, and we air new treats from Paul White, EAN, Moodprint, Boys in Lillies, The Yum Dee Days, and Geoff Rickley.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 11
results.subtitle: Listen To My Song
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Bells Atlas by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: After a tribute to Darondo, we air new soul and hip hop tip by Zeroh, Eric Lau, and Shad + Scratch Bastid. Paul White and Kelli Schaefer steer us into krautrock-inspired freak folk territory, Pilooski, Blackbird Blackbird, and XXYYXX provide the electronics, and Painted Palms and TV Girl the indie pop.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 10
results.subtitle: Music To Make You Melt
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Melt Yourself Down by Brett Affrunti.
results.desc: New musical heat including the soulful balladry of William Arcane, Cross My Heart, and Lady, plus the raucous Egyptian rhythms of Melt Yourself Down. We sneak peeks at future albums by Japanese sound design expert Yosi Horikawa and UK producer Eric Lau, and go to the beach with The Blank Tapes.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 09
results.subtitle: Have Tunes Will Travel
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Scrimshire by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Brand new music by Stratus, The City and Horses, and Free The Robots. We explore tracks from Portugal care of Papercutz and Marta Ren, go to Turkey with El Mahdy Jr, and air The Binary Cumbia Orchestra from Argentina. Scrimshire speaks words of wisdom and Dolly Gillmore drops vintage soul.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 08
results.subtitle: No Fakin’ The Cupcakin’
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Incredible Polo by Niklas Åkerblad.
results.desc: 80 minutes of the best of Bandcamp including beautiful busted soul by Firehorse, Son Lux, and our artist of the week Incredible Polo. Atmospheric electronics of The Cutler and Natasha Kmeto warm proceedings, Bosq and Karthala 72 turn the heat to tropical, and K-Maxx goes cupcakin’.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 07
results.subtitle: Lucky For Some
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Tall Black Guy by Brett Affrunti.
results.desc: Airing Australian soul from Oscar Key Sung, lo-fi tropical with Ruspo, Malian singer/guitarist Vieux Farke Touré, and African-influenced sounds by Zongo Junction and Electric Jalaba. Tall Black Guy talks about his new LP, and we finish with indie treats by Beach Vacation, fthrsn, and Hani Zahra.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 06
results.subtitle: Psyche Out
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Astrid Engberg by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: 80 minutes of the best of Bandcamp from hot Motown'ers Dames Brown, satirical rapper Kool AD, plus Argentinian folk, rare Latin funk, and indie sounds from Jesse Ruins, The Features and Standish Carlyon. Gaudi, Lee Scratch Perry and The Orb, Lewis James, and Mykal Rose go deep n'dubby.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 5
results.subtitle: Music Is The Universal Language
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of AM + Shawn Lee by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: This two-hour special features new music from Tropics, Scrimshire, Ty Segall, and electronic production don Marc Mac, plus a set of Brazilian ska, jazz, and Tropicália. AM & Shawn Lee drop by to talk about the album they released today, and we sneak peeks at releases from Dexter and Nancy Elizabeth.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 4
results.subtitle: Lookin’, searchin’, seekin’, findin’
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Troumaca by Niklas Åkerblad.
results.desc: On this week’s episode we get into hip hop and post-rock from Brazil, a tribute to Alice Coltrane, cinematic Russian electronics, a debut from The Decoders, and new music from Beacon and Danish singer Astrid Engberg. Gilles Peterson, BBC Radio 6 DJ, drops by to talk music biz and acts on his Brownswood label.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 3
results.subtitle: Three is a Magic Number
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Lion Babe by Brett Affrunti.
results.desc: 90 minutes of the best music on Bandcamp including Belgian boogie, vintage soul jazz, and various shades of dub from all corners of the world. This week's episode features music by French soul man Dandy Teru, Toronto-based funky post punk outfit Odonis Odonis, and the raucous sound of Melt Yourself Down.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 2
results.subtitle: I Know You Got Soul (and some...)
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Shafiq Husayn by Paul Grelet.
results.desc: 80 minutes of the best of Bandcamp including soul n'hip hop from L.A., Paris, Barcelona and Wales. Plus ethereal indie-flavors from Way Yes, Julian Lynch, and Sebastian Rochford with Brian Eno. Electronic beat-whizz Sweatson Klank chats about his new album, and we squeeze-in a folksy cover of The Pharcyde.

results.title: Bandcamp Weekly № 1
results.subtitle: Here We Go Yo, Here We Go
results.image_caption: Hosted by Andrew Jervis. Illustration of Helado Negro by Oliver Barrett.
results.desc: Diving into new tunes, previews, recent faves, classics, and obscurities from around the world, our first show features everything from rare Jamaican dub to West African blues. We air freshly minted tracks by Spazzkid, Owiny Sigoma, Incredible Polo, and Wild Honey, and grab words of wisdom from Shlohmo.
